page.title: 19RECREATION, NORTH PULBOROUGH
page.content: There are no public sports or leisure facilities in the area, other than the Rose and Crown public house. Gardening is the most popular recreation for local residents. Several of the larger houses have their own tennis courts and some a private swimming pool. Some houses and farms have stables and riding is popular. The area is well served with bridle paths,though the West Sussex County Council has only limited resources for keeping them clear. So local horseriders sometimes carry out the necessary clearance. Public footpaths offer good walking with pleasant views of the North and South Downs. Societies such as the Sussex Downsmen, Sussex Wealdsmen and the Ramblers Association arrange for the leading of walks through the area.
